position.marginalia_text: Item Notetis, quod Incolume dicitur sanum, vel mundum ab omni causa corruptionis

marginalia.translation: You should also note that the unharmed is said to be healthy or free of any cause of corruption.

position.marginalia_text: Item Hermes inquit, Filij, Philosophoru[m] corpora sunt septem: quoru[m] primus est sol, eorum optimus rex & Caput, quod nec terra corrumpit, nec res combure[n]s comburrit: nec aqua alteratur, eo quod complexio eius est temperata, & Natura directa, in caliditate &c

marginalia.translation: Likewise, Hermes says, my sone, there are seven bodies of the sages: the first of them is the sun, their greatest king and chief, which neither the world can corrupt, nor a destructive thing destroy, nor is water mortify, because its substancce is terminated in and its natue directed into heat etc.
